modules.description: Provides functions to manage UDP connections, including listening on ports, handling incoming packets, writing datagrams with optional source and TTL settings, and disconnecting. Operates on IP addresses, Cstruct.t buffers, and custom error types. Used to route network traffic, process incoming data, and send packets with controlled network parameters.

This module handles TCP connection management and data transfer, offering operations like reading, writing, disconnecting, and shutting down flows. It works with network flows, IP addresses, ports, and a type `t` representing connection states, supporting buffered or nodelay writes and error recovery. Use cases include building reliable network applications, managing bidirectional data streams, and ensuring controlled connection termination.

Provides pretty-printers for errors, IP addresses, and prefixes. Handles IP layer operations such as demultiplexing incoming packets, sending data with configurable fragmentation and TTL, and generating pseudoheaders for checksums. Works with IP addresses, prefixes, and network interfaces, supporting use cases like packet inspection, custom IP routing, and network diagnostics.

Manages network communication through UDP and TCP protocols, handling packet routing, flow control, and error reporting. Supports operations on IP addresses, buffers, and connection states, enabling precise control over data transmission and network behavior. Examples include sending datagrams with custom TTL, maintaining reliable TCP streams, and generating IP pseudoheaders for checksums. Provides tools for network diagnostics, packet inspection, and custom routing logic.

Sends time-series metrics over a network using the Influx wire protocol at regular intervals. It accepts a hostname and port to establish a connection and transmits structured data containing timestamps and key-value measurements. This is suitable for real-time monitoring in embedded or isolated environments where low-level network control is required.

Handles network communication via UDP and TCP, offering control over packet routing, flow management, and error handling. It manipulates IP addresses, buffers, and connection states, supporting tasks like sending datagrams with custom TTL values and maintaining reliable TCP streams. Provides functions for generating IP pseudoheaders, inspecting packets, and implementing custom routing logic. Enables precise network behavior tuning and diagnostics through low-level protocol manipulation.
